result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Carlton-Van Erby

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody Carlton-Van Erby not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Cody Carlton-Van Erby.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pretrial conference. Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Obscherning was just appointed to the case and has not had contact with the defendant.  Court issued a bench warrant STAYED until the next court date.  Case is adjourned to 12-8-22 at 8:30 am for a calendar call by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Calendar call scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. 

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with DDH;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Cody Carlton-Van Erby appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matt Lamke appeared by video for Cody Carlton-Van Erby. Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defense Counsel moves to strike Use Of Dangerous Weapon Modifier due to the wrong statute. State has no objection. Court orders modifier to be dismissed. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 

This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
